Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably red-figured, pottery calyx-krater; interior: reserved band near rim and centre of sherd, rest glazed; exterior: black rim; below, lack-figure ivy leave and berry band.
Producer name: Recalls: The Eucharides Painter (Beazley in CVA regarding Oxford 1912.39.2)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Beazley (CVA) connected the sherd with Oxford 1912.39.2, perhaps by the Eucharides painter, and Bonn 697.109 (CVA Bonn 1, pl. 16, no. 5),
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 493, no. C27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0186) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 120, pl. LXVI, no.14)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
